choices: An orc, drinking at the bar
A bugbear, towering over the bar
A group of dwarves, sat at one of the booths
A gnoll, sleeping at one of the tables
Someone or something else...
1.content:
As the effects of the backfired spell start to recede your senses start to flood back to you and almost instantly, dread sets into your stomach as you realise something is very wrong. This is not your lab. Wooden flooring stretches into the horizon with imperections in the wood that you could probably fit your body into were you to try, thick oaken tables and chairs stretches skyward, some one them filled by equally titanic members of various races. You had shrunk to a negligible size, and if the rowdiness and laughter that carries on the mead soaked air is anything to go by, this is a tavern at one of the busiest times of day. As you try to take in the grandness of your environment, you thank the stars that the spell had deposited you at right next to one of the corners of the tavern where you were unlikely to meet the booming feet of any of the inn's patrons, be they boots, paws, hooves or otherwise. This should give you some time to plan ahead.

You feel that your best option is to try and get the attention of one of the many patrons of the bar and hope that they are willing to help you at your diminuitive size. You eventually finish considering this and decide to head to...
1.title: Small and Secluded

choices: Climb up to the bar
Climb up the chair
Climb up his leg
Bang against his boot to get his attention
11.content:
You spot an orc in the distance nursing a pint of what was likely ale at the bar. Often strict and militaristic, you've never seen an orc smile or laugh at a joke in your laugh and judging by the grim expression on the tusked lips of this one, you doubt that's going to be any different. That isn't to say orcs can't be helpful or even kind, it's just they rarely show any form of emotion other than apathy or rage in the heat of combat. You feel that the orc will at least take your situation seriously if he finds you and is one of the closest patrons to you - which will certainly reduce the risk of being trampled on or worse.

Sticking to the edge of the wall, you avoid the thundering footsteps of the tavern's guests. You however, can't do much against the whirlwind of dirt and dust that is kicked up against you on your journey, as you shield your head from some of the larger pieces of debris; you also can't do much to protect yourself from the smells that permeate your nostrils this close to the floor, particularly that of dirt and unwashed fur. Still, you make it to the booted feet of the orc without much stress and are now able to take into account the immenseness of the green skinned creature before you.

The cracked ravines of boot leather loom above you as it stretches upward to the frayed trousers of the orc. Further above, the green muscled plains of the torso are covered by little more than a leather vest as you gawk above at the apathetic tusked face occasionally taking in vast amounts of ale. You need to decide how you're going to get this titan's attention, climbing him is an option but orcs aren't exactly a small race, typically standing a few inches higher than most humans like you. Another option is to climb the bar or chair to get to a better position to get his attention or to just bang against his foot and hope he doesn't assume you're an insect.
11.title: Orcs and Odyssies

choices: Scale the mountainous bugbear
Attack his foot
Bugbears are messy drinkers...
12.content:
It is quite difficult to ignore the absolutely gargantuan yellow skinned creature standing just adjacent to the bar drinking what looked to be something more akin to a barrel of ale than a mug like the other patrons. Obviously even the smallest of creatures towered over you at this size but the titanic goblinoid made everything else in the room seem just as small as you. Bugbears generally aren't the sharpest tools in the shed, and can be prone to violence when they don't understand things but for the most part are generally docile creatures, even to those smaller than them. In addition, he isn't particularly far from you and is standing in relatively quiet section of the bar.so the foot traffic to get to him should be fairly light.

Your trip to the titan is relatively unneventful as you navigate the imperfections in the wooden floor on your approach; you do narrowly avoid a large paw slamming down on you at the midpoint of your journey, its owner not even noticing the crumb sized human it could have crushed but soon you are at the base of the mountain and good stars, this gargantuan did not get any smaller on your trek over...

Long jet black claws jut out like some kind of warped construction ahead of you, not assisted by the large, brown furred humanoid feet that flanked it. A pair of tattered trousers (the only thing the bugbear wears) stretch upwards like a pair of monoliths before reaching the massive hill like gut of the creature, the brown fur upon it stretching across it like a distant forest. You are just barely able to make out the face of your possible saviour behind the excessive paunch, but are able to make out a very distant goblinoid face, uncaring to the issues that go on underfoot. It goes without saying but climbing this creature would be no easy task, even with the fur to help you assist in climbing; that being said, an equally valid option would be to attack his foot to get his attention.
12.title: Bugbears and Bargaining

choices: "Cleans" his spill
Notices your distressed splashing
123.content:
As you plan your route of attack, you watch the titan down seemingly gallons of ale in mere seconds you remember something else about bugbears; they are often clumsy due to their size, and that extends to drinking. Luckily, thus far this had only extended to some spillage upon the thick pelt of the creature but unfortunately, your luck wouldn't last.

As the creature took one more swig of the beverage, he had clearly misjudged the speed at which he did so causing some of the ale to overspill. Ordinarily, this would have fallen onto his pelt but it seems that this time the liquid has a different destination in mind. The floor, where YOU are standing.

Normally, a bit of spilled alcohol in a pub is nothing to cry about but that's when it isn't the size of a descending lake. You brace yourself as the lake of ale crashes to the ground before you and a rolling wave of brown liquid threatens to pull you under. Panicking and struggling to breathe, you desperately try to regain your composure as the wave settles and you're able to swim in the relatively shallow lake; the situation was absolutely terrifying but you had pulled through with little more than a scratch. As your view returns to the visage above, you realise something is very different. The bugbear is looking right at you. Well, probably at the spilled ale and not you, but this is still a good opportunity to get his attention without the arduous climb. Desperately hoping to get the creature's attention, you wave your arms as much as you can in the shallow pool of ale as the bugbear looks on.

The fixation from the bugbear continues until it looks like he's doing something. Had he seen you? Or maybe he's just going to clean up the mess he made? It's difficult to say and your only option is to watch the titan put his ale to one side. The bugbear proceedes to bend down and get onto both knees, the very foundation of the tavern seemingly shaking as each knee drops to the floor, kicking up waves of the ale and threatening to pull you under once again. The horizon spanning face only gets larger as he inspects the spillage before him and you're able to get a better look at his face. A forest of fur spans the outside features of his face, resembling a large bushy beard and sideburns as they reach up to the large pointed ears of the creature. Each ear adorned with golden earrings twitches slightly at the sounds around the busy inn. As your eyes move towards the eyes of the beast, it is difficult to ignore the large cavernous mouth spewing a concoction of alcohol and whatever food the beast had earlier, causing you to gag. Lastly you notice the eyes spanning your entire vision, the piercing amber yellow eyes of the creature glare into you as he looks on quizzically. After a few tense moments the bugbear...
123.title: Spillage and Survival

choices: The End
Or is it?
1231.content:
You watch as the god like bugbear opens his cave like mouth, but not to speak as you had initially hoped. Slowly but surely the large worm like tongue of the behemoth works its way out from its place of rest and you realise what the creature was doing. He was cleaning up his mess, without any of it going to waste.

Realising this you try to swim to the edge of the pool of ale and find some route of escape but even as you do so you realise any action is too late at this point. The large tongue of the bugear extends upwards like a heavenly tower as it contacts the floor below, eagerly advancing as it begins to happily lick up the pool of ale before you. The waves crash against you and soon, the wall of pink is upon you. You are unable to do anything but grab onto the taste buds of the rolling wall as it returns to its home inside the maw.

The mouth closes behind you as you are deposited into the dark and humid mouth with little more than the smell of alcohol and the sound of pulsating flesh to keep you company. You bounce around as you feel your large captor get off of his knees and return to the bar, before he does so however, he has one last thing to do...

Holding on and hoping that this isn't the end for you, the ground below you starts to undulate and raise into the air. There is little you can do as the undulations throw you to the back of the throat and a large GULP deafens you.

As the esophagus pulls you down to the belly of the beast, you think over the choices you had made. If only you had chosen a different creature or had just decided to climb the bugbear instead of waiting around... It was no use admonishing yourself for it and as you approached the sphincter of the stomach you accepted your fate as nothing more than food for the unaware bugbear...
1231.title: Licking and Leaving

choices: Foot
Paw
Hoof
12312.content:
Waiting in the bubbling stomach of the bugbear, there is little you can do as the pool of ales churn around you and the disgusting smell of chyme pierces your nostrils. There is little dignity in spending the rest of your short life within the bowels of some creature, but you decide to hang on to what little of it you have by accepting your fate and slumping down against one of the walls of this cavernous stomach. Soon your ordeal will all be over. Soon enough, you slip into unconciousness from the lack of air and you accept your fate as food to some unaware being.

That doesn't happen.

The oppressive humid atmosphere of the stomach is gone, replaced by the much needed feeling of wind on your cheeks. But that must mean? You open your eyes. Your previous residence is no more, but the location you have found yourself at is not exactly familiar either. Irregular jagged brown hills and mountains stretch around you into the horizon, with little else disturbing your view other than a long grey tube like rocky monolith in the distance. Looking to the skies does not provide many answers either, as shapes and colours blend together in a blur, with a dim sun barely perturbing the cacophony of colour. The distinct smell of vinegar is the only thing that your nose is able to register, perhaps the only thing you recognise in this alien landscape and welcome it. Still puzzled, you try to listen around for any errant sounds, but can only make out the sounds of distant quakes, no doubt from this land's unusual tectonics. Your current location is a mystery and you decide it is better to try and find some answers than sitting around doing nothing. Knowing this, you decide to head to the only thing of note on this plain - the long monolith.

You walk across the landscape, trying to avoid falling into narrow ravines and keeping your footing on the jagged hills you must climb. You find the texture of the ground interesting, as while it is hard it isn't nearly as rugged as something like rock which only puzzles you further. It's almost as if the ground is made of wood, but such a thing would be prepostorous. Your trek isn't the easiest endeavour and you start getting closer to the unusual grey monolith, it's appearance softening in your vision as you approach it; its appearance is almost snake like- like some grand sea serpent of old. Of course, such a thing would be impossible. Sea serpents like the sea after all.

The appearance resolves some more as you approach, it's appearance looking almost scaled - several layers stacking upon each other in a way that would resemble the bark of a palm tree or something similar. While trying to think of a feasible explanation, your world is rocked by large quakes as you are thrown to the ground. Your envirnoment's source of light now blotted by an immesurably large shadow, you look up to the heavens and finally, your world starts to make sense. Descending from the skies is a gargantuan...
12312.title: Surviving, but separated

choices: Climb the foot
Desperate times - time to attempt a teleportation spell
As you are thinking, a fly lands nearby
123121.content:
Looking up to the sky you witness a massive, blurry yellow brownish mass start to descend upon you - blocking out the sun as it does so. Several miles in size, you wouldn't even hope to outrun the thing if it came down on you and unfortunately you are only able to watch as it makes its meteoric descent before you.

The object crashes into the ground only a few hundred feet in front or you, causing a massive shockwave and kicking up a massive hurricane as it disturbs the ground below. As the object starts to rest and you realise it no longer poses any immediate threat to you, you attempt to scan it over.

The colossal object is primarily a brownish yellow, with what looks like dark brown trees growing upon the tops of its slopes. The front of it is supported by five black warped spires that each extend from the front of the objects to a few dozen feet off the ground like some unusual gothic structure. As you piece this together with the other limited information and the familiarity of recent brownish objects you are only able to accept one possible, terrifying solution.

You had shrunk. Again.

The object in front of you could only be the foot of the bugbear that very nearly added you to the fat on his paunch; the large cylindrical object next to you is a single strand of hair on the floor of this planet sized tavern. It seems that in order to keep you alive, the spell resolved once more. You were indeed alive, but now even your previous size would be monolithic as you now struggled to compete with most motes of dust for size. Knowing this, you had to physically restrain yourself from curling up into a ball and crying to yourself.

Okay. You were small. Microscopic even. A single hair could crush you at this size, but it doesn't mean you have to give up! Right?

Thinking on your feet, you feel you only really have one option here. Climbing the miles of foot of front of you, even if only to get off the ground and give some protection from the harsh reality of being living dust on the floor of a busy tavern. Worst case scenario, the rest of your life on the foot of a bugbear can't be that bad right? Right...

Anyway, there is one other potential solution. Knowing that you still have the capability for the arcane after your second mishap, you could attempt to harness that energy into a teleportation spell - almost like peeling the layers off of an orange without taking the fruit. It of course carries significant risk, as messing it up will make you even smaller and you're not even sure how much smaller you could get at this point.

Knowing this, you decide to...
123121.title: Feet and Fleeing

choices: Start climbing
Wait, you're not sure when the gnoll will wake
One of the paws is approaching you. Fast!
14.content:
You think over the choices of the many inhabitants of the inn, trying to decide who would be the best to contact in your vertically challenged predicament. Perhaps you could...what is that incessant noise?

Spinning around to scan the rest of the inn, you find the source sitting at one of the tables in the centre of the room. Maw wide and dripping drool, the spotted creature produced quite the cacophony in its slumber. A snoring gnoll. Typical. You had employed a few gnolls in your time for some help with some heavy lifting and you recall how they spent most of their time on the job sleeping unless motivated with the promise of food; of course, it wouldn't be fair to generalise an entire species like that but you doubted the one towering in front of you would be any different, as drops of his saliva fell to the floor. Knowing this, you think it might actually work to your advantage. A lazy creature is a stationary creature, and it would certainly make climbing that tawny fur much easier and risk free than the other inhabitants of the bar.

Your mind made up, you set out on a quest to reach the base of the gnoll. You dart from table to table, avoiding the slamming of paws and the crushing of boots as you are able to make it to your target. Looking up at your possible saviour, it really starts to dawn on you how large the gnoll is compared to you, his large paws shuffling against the wooden floor - easily able to snuff you out if he wished. Looking passed the paws, you see the only piece of clothing the gnoll could bother to wear, some woollen shorts which is clearly protesting underneath the large paunch it had to carry, no doubt itself filled with all manner of stews and ales right now. You are just about able to make out the face of the gnoll over the stomach, it still creating a racket in its dormant state.

Ready for the next part of the plan you...
14.title: Stick with what you gnoll...

choices: You make it to the belly without incident
The gnoll rests his hand on the leg
The gnoll shifts in his sleep, throwing you off!
141.content:
You observe the monolithic paws shift and stretch as the gnoll slumbers above; toes cycle between rubbing against one another and splaying as the sounds of ligaments stretching and tendons popping fill your miniscule ears. You observe this a few times before, finally, the paw lies still and rests against the floor with a loud thud. If you want to scale the beast, now would be the time.

You approach the paws, becoming dangerously close should the gnoll above start to rouse again. The distinct, but not unpleasant smell of vinegar permeates your nostrils as you approach the toes, the digits moving ever so slightly as the titan breathes above you. Not wasting any time, you manage to grab onto an errant tuft of fur that sat just above the paw pads – only emasculating you further as you realise you were just barely level with the fur level of the paw. Pulling yourself up the tawny fur, you are fairly easily able to grab handholds in the fur, so long as you avoid the clumps of dirt and other detritus that have become knotted inside patches of the fur; a natural downside of the gnoll wearing no footwear. Despite this, it isn’t too hard to avoid them and the smell of dirtied paw is pretty light all things considered. You might have to thank the gnoll for that if you can get his attention. You continue to climb and soon enough you reach the top of the paw and breathe a sigh of relief as you hope the most dangerous part of this climb is over.

You start to climb the leg next, and while the journey is longer, you are able to steady yourself on patches of fur and take periodic breaks as you climb. It comes as a surprise then, when you reach a white plain of furless cotton earlier than expected – the shorts. Initially pulling yourself up onto the shorts proves rather tricky as you find it awkward to find handholds on the new surface, but soon enough you are able to find some purchase in some of the gaps between the thread of the shorts and pull yourself up onto the knee, allowing you to take a break from climbing as you walk along the thigh for the rest of the journey.

You look up at the mountain you have scaled half of, its mouth still hung open with its tongue lolling out and face still pointed skyward. You are kind of surprised that the gnoll has still not awakened, but you felt it best not to criticise – after all, you wouldn’t have had a relatively time climbing the creature otherwise. You observe the path ahead and notice that the waist of the shorts had been pulled up to the midpoint of the belly; you weren’t entirely sure why, perhaps it makes the shorts easier to wear without them slipping off? Or they had merely ridden up in his sleep? You didn’t know and honestly the reason didn’t matter. It would be slightly harder to climb the rest of the way due to the material of the shorts being more awkward to climb on than the spotted fur, but you felt it best not to complain.

You continue on your journey…
141.title: A knoll of a gnoll

choices: The belly starts to rumble violently
The belly rumbles, but it’s pretty mild
The gnoll rubs his stomach
1411.content:
The walk down the thigh is rather uneventful, even leisurely if you dare say so, being able to take in the many sights and sounds of a tavern much larger than you from a much safer position. You had to be honest with yourself, there was a certain beauty in seeing things at this size that really made you see the world in a much different way. The creatures you once called friends and workmates were now terrain to be explored and scouted. For example, you had probably seen more of this gnoll than he himself had seen in his entire life! If only the circumstances of you dilemma weren’t quite so life threatening, you think you’d enjoy seeing even more of the world at this reduced size. Sighing, you continue on with your journey, pushing those thoughts to the periphery of your mind for now. You have a mountain to scale.

You reach the edge of the thigh and look on as the material of the shorts starts to warp and bend as it curves towards the waist. The edge of the material stretches on for some distance and you start climbing. Initially finding handholds proves rather difficult, but using your method of finding gaps between the seams of fabric you are eventually able to get into a rhythm and make some good progress in your climb. It is not long before you reach the waist of the material and pull yourself up, coming face to face with the mountainous belly of the gnoll. The stomach gurgles and whines before you like some sort of wild creature as you stand on the thin waistband of the shorts, giving yourself a short breather before the rest of the climb. Not much further now.

Ready to continue, you grab some fur around the belly button and start to hoist yourself up, the climb soon becoming easier as you reach the incline of the belly and you find you can start walking to the chest for the final leg of the climb. The chubby ground below you is rather uneven as you continue your ascent, nearly falling over a few times. As you start walking...
1411.title: A different kind of gnoll...

choices: You manage to keep your grip
You can’t keep hold
14111.content: The rumbles you are accustomed to start to grow more and more violent. It seems like the gnoll’s belly is growing restless! You dive onto the spongy ground and attempt to hold on against the quaking intestinal movements
14111.title: Hold on!

choices: The gap in the waistband
The chair below
Somewhere else?
141112.content: Whether it be your sweaty palms or the oily fur of the titan, you are unable to keep hold as the rumbles throw you down the cliff like face of stomach. You tumble and fall, the softness of the stomach thankfully cushioning some of your fall. You slide off the belly and head towards...
141112.title: Greasy gnoll

choices: Slide further down…
Remain where you are…
1411121.content:
You tumble and slide off the edge of the belly, unable to do much as you are ejected from quaking mountain. Your slide is not far however and as you close your eyes and brace for impact, you find the insides of the arms resting on something. You open your eyes. You had fallen into the waistband of the gnoll, with only your arms and shoulders keeping you outside, as your arms rest of the waistband stopping you from going any further.

The waistband hugs tightly against the belly of the gnoll, restricting your movement; the gurgling and churning of the stomach only getting louder as the space becomes more cramped. The way you have landed is going to make it awkward to pull yourself out in this position so you feel you have two options. You can put your arms up and allow yourself to fall into the shorts of the gnoll or you can remain where you are, hoping that the gnoll shifts at some point and allows you to escape.
1411121.title: An unlikely saviour

choices: Nothing happens, the gnoll still slumbers
The gnoll shifts a little, allowing you to escape.
Bowls are being put on the table. A feast!
14111212.content: You decide to remain where you are, thinking that staying put would be far safer than heading into the dark and dingy abyss that is a gnoll’s shorts. You are unable to do little but listen to the churning and stretching of the gut against the backside which you start to find oddly relaxing after some time despite your position. Eventually…
14111212.title: Remain where you are…

choices: A chance! You slip upwards, free from the waistband
The gnoll leans forward again, sliding you downwards into his shorts
You had enough. You try to get the gnoll's attention
141112123.content:
You had almost been dozing off yourself, awaiting for the right chance to move and escape from your precaurious position. You weren't in danger, but you didn't like the thought of staying right where you were for longer than necessary. At the first move that would allow you to escape, you would.

There was something strange about feeling relaxed from hearing the noise of the gnoll's digestive system being hard at work right behind you, but it was better than fretting and getting your blood pressure up. If there was one thing you had, was patience.

Suddenly a different noise breaks your reverie. You hear the noise of bowls and plates being left somewhere -- noise you had been hearing a lot on your trek towards the gnoll, but this time, they're coming from way closer. You look upwards, at the underside of the table. It was up there!

"...about time"

You hear those words, like a growl hinting something ominous happening. The sound of a feast being left on the table had finally awoken the gnoll, and there you were, still trapped between the waistband and his belly. Not the best position to be in! The gnoll leaned forward, unwittingly pressing you against the waistband. It felt like your torso had gotten trapped into a vice! The gnoll's formidable body was squeezing you, and he was none the wiser!

At first you tried to endure it, hoping for a chance in the situation, but the gnoll kept moving. You heard noises above you, the noises of the gnoll taking food from the bowls and getting them closer to him. Before long, he'd start devouring everything up there. Things would be moving, but it could turn pretty uncomfortable. The gnoll moved, again pressing you, this time hard enough to make it hard to breathe.

You gasp for breath once the brief grip goes away. This couldn't keep happening, you had to do something right now! If you stayed there, you'd find yourself with a few bruises in matter of minutes, if not something worse! Getting a rib cracked could prove dangerous -- not that you couldn't heal it yourself, but still! You'd rather not to suffer that.

Now you had to move before the situation took the decision for you. You got ready, bracing for the right moment to make a move.
141112123.title: Feast Incoming

choices: You’re splayed out on his tongue. Looks like you’re going to be washed down!
You’re pressed up against his inner cheek. Seems you’re in for a wet, wild ride.
You’re perched atop one of his canines. You could jump out and reach his lips!
1411121231.content:
Trapped between the brink of three worlds: the cool air of outside—the rumbling, gurgling realm that lay just beyond the veneer of the gnoll’s fur—and the musky heat of his crotch. You fill palms with fistfulss of hair, steading your body as the gnoll shifts above. You feel his abs flex. He pulls himself closer, scooting his chair—causing it to squeak across the tavern’s hardwood floor. Though you’re pinned for the moment, when his bottom drifts backwards after scooting, the hold of his waistband loosens.
         It’s just enough.
         You’re able to pull yourself free. Your arms shake as your rise, unused to physical activity more strenuous than lifting a quill. But adrenaline gives you the strength you need. His waistband snaps behind you, sealing the sweltry portal closed. The snap waistband acts as a fan—blowing hot air over your tiny form that reeks of sweat and damp fur.
You hear him take a good long sniff. “Wild hare stew,” he growls, letting the steam whet his nostrils, “ahh—love it. The bits carrots bobbin’ there? Makes taste that much better. It’s the irony, yeah?” His throaty speak is quiet, almost lost in the jabbering of the busy tavern. Doesn’t seem that he’s talking to anyone in particular. Maybe he’s lonely—missing the pack. Or maybe just likes talking to himself.
         The bowl scrapes against its serving plate as the gnoll grips it in his paws. You decide this is a better time than any to get away and continue your ascent. You’re only a few centimeters up when you see the dark shadow of the soup bowl loom overhead. Not the most dextrous of fellow, he accidentally tilts it to the side. A splash of soup pours out—plummeting like a god’s tear.
         You’re in the drop zone.
         Meat soup splashes over over you, washing you onto his pant leg. The liquid is thick and viscous. It oozes over you while holding you down with a frightening amount of weight. It burns slightly—but not enough to harm. Thankfully, the cook was wise enough to let it sit before serving.
         “Damn it,” the gnoll huffs, setting his bowl down with a clatter. “Hate wastin’ grub.”
         Another shadow looms. It’s gnoll’s clawed finger.
         “I ain’t lettin’ this shit go to waste. Especially since I’m the one payin’.”
         You squirm as the furry obelisk scoops you up. Soup clings to his hairs, thickening and darkening them as they absorb the waters in the soup. You’re surrounded from every which way by soaked hairs. They begin to stick together as they reach maximum saturation. The soup no longer able to be absorbed, it sits there in a basin of wet hair. You’re floating in the middle—like a mosquito trapped in amber.
         You frantically attempt to wipe soup from eyes. But your arms and hands are drenched. Everytime you wipe it away, more of the pungent, steaming water sloshes down from your sopping hair. You’re able to blink once in between. And each time it’s like a snapshot.
         The gnoll hefts you into the heavens.
         Blink.
         His tongue flops out like a lazy dog. His maw opens.
         Blink.
         You’re hovering above his yellowed fangs. Nauseating breath clocks you like a brick in the face. Its rankness ranks somewhere between never-washed sailor breath and a spoiled meat pantry. His pancake, floppy dog tongue shoots at you, lapping you up with a watery slurp before you have another chance to blink.
         Now swimming blindly in a puddle of spit, the world grows hot and muggy. Worse than than tropics where the feather-donned snakefolk thrive, the air sweats with rank heat. With the added wetness around you, you’re able to wash over the soup covering your face. You open your eyes—just in time to see the last of your light snuff with a clack of the gnoll’s jaws.
Darkness has never felt so heavy. You can’t see; but you can feel. You’re swished around without even a thought on the gnoll’s part—just the chaotic flow of the wash in his mouth gives you a far-too-intimate tour. You skid across his gums, feeling the squishy flesh on your back. You bounce off his fangs: bumpers hard as ivory.
         Your own dinner wanting to come up, you shake your head and try to get any sense of your surroundings.
         The dawn breaks. The gnoll opens his jaws. The white light of the taverns cracks through. The black shadow imprint of his fangs hang above and below: the stalactites and stalagmites of this fermented meat-smelling cave.
         In his hands: a soup bowl. It tips forward.
         But where are you when the flood arrives?
1411121231.title: Slurp and Sniff

choices: Use your magic to try to escape. It may be worth the risk
The gnoll is your only option. Talk to him
Resign to your fate. There's nothing you can do
14111212311.content:
There are moments when a man feels in danger and everything comes to a stop. Right now, when you see a bowl coming, it feels like that's happening.

You're not in the best place to weather a deluge of soup. All that bouncing you did around in the gnoll's mouth brought you to roll there in the middle of his tongue, saliva slowing you down and making you stick there. Great! You're in trouble. You can see the near future: soup washing you down the gullet of an unaware gnoll. As if that was going to be a fun thing to do. There was no way you were letting such a thing happen, not if you could do something about it!

Perhaps it was a desperate move, but you tried to crawl forward, towards the tip of the tongue. You were trying to get away, you didn't think of going towards a side to avoid it -- you didn't want to be in the gnoll's mouth, you wanted to be out! Did you even want the gnoll's help anymore? After it ate you and what not?

Probably not. Not unless this was your only choice in the entire world.

Just like the saliva stopped you before, now it's slowing your escape. You can grasp the tastebuds, you can drag yourself forward, but it's like crawling on a thick film of slime -- not too far from the truth, really. You're going much slower than you'd like. The soup makes contact with the gnoll's lips before you're able to get to the tip of the tongue, the tongue extends slightly a little to receive the incoming liquid. Oh god.

It's like being hit by magma...by lukewarm magma. Tasty liquid, really made from wild hare and carrots, hit you, forcing you to close your eyes. Your grip on the tongue relaxes, you're washed away by the liquid. Bits of carrots smack you, you're in a river and your destination is obvious: you're going towards the back of the gnoll's mouth, towards the throat.

This may be your last chance.

"Help!" you call. At this point you don't care about anything but getting out of this alive. You're right there in his head, surely he can hear something! You manage to pop your head from the soup, yelling again: "Help!"

There's no response from the gnoll other than a satisfied murmur. He didn't hear you.

You had never thought you'd experience how it's like to be swallowed, but here you were, a bit of meat more in addition to the soup. You don't see a thing before the throat catches you and you plunge down his throat, soup enveloping all of you. You tumble down the throat, into the esophagus, while you hear the gnoll say to the air:

"Now that hit the spot"

Good for him, bad for you. So many times you had hired gnoll as help by offering them food, now you were part of food for a gnoll. Was that some twisted irony? Didn't seem so, but right now that was all you could think while you plummeted down the tube, towards a stomach where your death could await.

You didn't notice when you entered the stomach, next you knew you had plunged into a swampy place. You're completely drenched, soaked in warm liquids, and forced to swim upwards until you break the surface. You cough right away, the acid air making you ache right away. Oh, this wasn't good at all!

You needed to find some stable terrain, fast.

For now, you grip a piece of carrot larger than normal, getting on it as some sort of improvised raft. Right now you can't see much, but a hastily murmured enchantment solves it. You didn't like the thought of using magic while you were shrunken, but this was an emergency, a big one. If there was a time to take risks, it was now.

You were greeted by the stomach walls contracting, the contents sloshing around while the gnoll continued his feast. Judging by the state of the carrot piece, it wasn't going to be long before you fell into the contents of the stomach again, and things could get dicey if that happened. For now, you started working on something that could protect you, even if it was temporary, a reprieve from the possibility of getting digested by the unknowing gnoll.

While you worked, you considered your options. At this rate you were in mortal danger, you had to solve that first. Afterwards, it was all about getting back to the lab. How to do this...
14111212311.title: Flood

choices: Hears you, and looks down
Does not hear you, and continues feasting
1411121233.content: Knowing that you need to act quickly, you desperately flail against the doughy midsection of the gnoll keeping you captive, pleading to the creature to let you out before you the pressure becomes too much for you. The gnoll…
1411121233.title: Gno attention

choices: Continues eating
Stops eating
14111212332.content:
Despite your protests, the gnoll is either unwilling or unable to assist you in your predicament, instead continuing dish out monstrously sized portions onto his own plate. It seems like your only course of action now is to whether the storm, and try to make do until your captor either finds you or you can make some sort of escape. You can only look in horror as the titan continues to heap food onto a large plate, now starting to resemble some sort of alien construct made from mutton, mashed potatoes and a wide selection of delicacies. It times some time, but the gnoll is soon done, pulling in his chair and allowing himself to recline a little – easing some of the pressure on your sore body.

The face above you now looks like a demon possessed, ripping through food and drinking gallons of ale in what seemed like minutes all the while unaware of its little passenger that is taking residence below. The feasting only continues. Bite after bite. Drink after drink. It is almost like a craft how effortlessly the meal was going down and as more and more of the stodgy cuisine enters the gut keeping you captive. It was subtle at first, but the belly is definitely becoming larger and more distended with every passing minute, pushing you against the waistband more and more as the pressure only increases.

You plead for the pressure to cease as the gnoll…
14111212332.title: Feasting

choices: You are free
Still trapped
141112123321.content: Your pleas are once again unheard as the gnoll continues to stuff his face with an assortment of foodstuffs. The pressure is intense, but the soft fat behind you gives you some reprieve from the true pressure, the sound of the stomach working overtime to digest its meal ringing in your ears as the consumption continues. With little else for the growing gut to go, the flabby folds start to envelop you, slowly filling your vision until you are unable to see anything more than fur as you accept your fate as being nothing more than gnoll flab. Knowing there is nothing else you can do in your predicament, you allow yourself to fall into a slumber, hoping that when you aware you’d be free from this glutton…
141112123321.title: ...and feasting

choices: You move to leave the waistband
The guts behind you rumble. Is there something going on?
The gnoll starts rolling on the bed
1411121233212.content:
The first thing you notice when you wake up is that you're in a horizontal position. The gnoll isn't sitting to a chair anymore! The second thing you notice is that you're still trapped. The waistband is still holding you, you still have the gnoll's body behind you. Just how tough was this waistband, that even after this long it still managed to hold you this much? You feel strange, like the blood has rushed to your head.

Despite that, you should take a look around. There's nobody around anymore, you're not anywhere under a table anymore. Instead, you seem to be in a room. A cheap, kind of shabby room, but it's private and clean enough. Are you still in the same inn? Probably.

The fact you were still trapped most likely meant you hadn't been noticed yet. The gnoll was sleeping -- his snores rattled everything around. You could make a lot of noise, and he would be none the wiser. Great! You still were on your own, still held there. But since he was sleeping, you may be able to move without he noticing, too. You were at liberty of trying much harder to get out of there, and given it was a horizontal position, you should be able to go in any direction you wanted. You grabbed some of the gnoll's belly fur, pulling yourself upwards a little. Indeed, you managed to move. Good.

You took a deep breath, preparing yourself. All you could hear was the gnoll's snores, and the noise of his digestive system working on his meal. Time to make your move.
1411121233212.title: Still Trapped

choices: Climb the belly to get closer to the face
Sod this – find a way off the bed
Something’s wrong – did you get smaller?
14111212332121.content: With the gnoll now resting, it should be much easier to pull yourself from your impromptu prison against the belly. You shuffle and snake against the damp fur, making slow and deliberate movements against the soft, pliable ground and find the pressure becomes far more manageable as you drag yourself against the dump fur. Much like a live manaworm attempting to escape a hungry kobold, you relentlessly worm your way out of the confines of the prison until the pressure is no more. You can breathe freely again, even if most of the ‘fresh’ air has the distinct, but not unpleasant smell of earthy fur attached to it. Anything breathable is a welcome reprieve right now. After taking a few seconds to appreciate your newfound freedom, you decide...
14111212332121.title: No use waisting time

choices: Climb the belly mountain
Climb a strand of fur to take lookout
Accept your new life
141112123321213.content: Your relief from escaping your prison is short lived as your comfort is soon replaced with an air of confusion. The surrounding area was familiar, the smell of gnoll fur proving to a surprising reassurance to you in your current predicament but also alien at the same time; branchless brown trees lurched above you with a featureless grimace as the flesh coloured ground below you quaked and gurgled without restraint. It took a few seconds to clear the foggy haze from your mind and think of a reason, but you soon had only one possible explanation. You had shrunk in your unconsciousness. You didn’t know why and honestly, you didn’t care much to find out why but you were now smaller than the individual strands of fur that towered above you like redwoods. The gnoll is now starting to seem less like a creature you once considered an equal and now more like an entire world until himself; you could probably spend the rest of your life mapping out the entire expanse of his belly at this point, at least until you were sent flying by an errant scratch or drowned in an errant droplet of ale. That clearly would not do. Fearing that time may be of the essence you…
141112123321213.title: Gargantuan Gnoll

choices: A kobold, sitting at a table and stuggling to hold an ale
A minotaur, sat on one of the side tables
A ratkin, skulking in the corner of the room
Maybe I'll just stay put for now?
Something else...
15.content: You decide against the previous options and instead head to...
15.title: Reflection and Reconsideration

choices: You leap off his tail and manage to snag the rim of his pant-hole. You’re out!
Too slow! You’re hit with whiplash as the kobold tumbles backward onto his botto
He rights himself! He’s reaching across the table, holding his ale—butt in air.
151.content:
Amongst the rabble and babble of the giant tavern patrons is the less giant, still massive, scrawny form of a comparatively-small lizard person. Ruddy scaled, snub-snouted, with a shirt full of holes, the vermin struggles to hold his mug—courtesy of his twig-stick arms. You, being a noble practitioner of the arcane magics, don't have a high opinion of kobolds. They're pests who steal your unused mixing bottles and help themselves to your potion ingredients—like it's some sort of buffet. You don’t care to consider that not every kobold is a thief—or that most could actually be good people. You'll never forget the day they ate all of your manaworms…
         But desperate times call for desperate measures. You're smaller than a toothpick. And you'd rather try your luck attracting the attention of the smallest giant here. After spending a healthy minute observing the creature, you see him finally succeed in lifting the ale. The froth sloshes down, soaking his face in a tidal wave of foam. He sputters, letting the ale slam onto the hard wooden table before barking a curse in his native draconic tongue. You adjust your shrunken (yet still fine) green robes and begin the long trek forward. Hiding under barstools, passing under kicking, rowdy feet, you're able to scamper towards the big-little lizard. His shoeless, clawed feet dangle above you. Your gaze traces from his clawed feet, up his two-joint leg, and ending at his scaly face—soaked in alcohol. His eyes are half-closed with an irritated acceptance. Wading through puddles of spilt drink, you pause to think: how in the nine realms are you going to get up there?
         ...Aha! His tail—spindly—covered in interlocked scales that, at your size, look like a finely-made suit of dragon scale mail. Tiny spikes poke from between his hide, lining the top of his tail with bone-colored pricks. His tail is quite the ways up, but with some creative jungle-gyming up the frame of the barstool, you’d surely be able to grab on! Staying on there, however, is less than certain.
         You clamber and climb. Next came a handful of risky leaps to one wood beam to another. You leap off with all the grace of an untrained adventurer—barely managing to reach the kobold’s tail. Without a second’s waste, you scramble to find a handhold—managing to wrap your hands around a spike. Your heart rises in your throat as your stomach rattles in your ribcage. You’re tossed about with the tail’s lazy movements, swaying back and forth like the tail of an idle cat.
          After an arduous, yet uneventful climb, you climb to the root of the kobold’s tail: the thick part between his legs and above his butt. His pants have a haphazardly-cut hole in the rear for his tail to pass through. Clearly sized for a halfling, the old cloth smells like mildew and hobo.
          Right at the moment when you’re about to latch onto the hem of his pants, vying to climb higher, the feeble lizard wobbly stands up—balancing on the beam of the barstool—reaching for the ale placed just out of his reach. You rise with him. Digging the tips of your fingers between the gaps of his scales, you hold on for your life. The poorly-sized hole of his pants shadows over you. The scent of mildew grows stronger, coupled with the funk of what has to be kobold ass. Uh oh…
          You have to get out of here—and fast! You can already feel the kobold wobble. He seems like he’s about to lose his balance…
151.title: Liquor and Lizards

choices: You slide along his braies. You notice you’re beneath his wrinkled tailhole...
You tumble to the front of his underwear. You pray kobold junk is internal...
You roll beneath his thigh. He’s about to sit down and enjoy a nice, long drink.
1513.content:
Gravity works against you as you’re hoisted up by his arching tail. The kobold leans over the table, balancing on the stool by the tips of his toes, bracing himself with the weight of the three-quarter filled ale mug. His claws holding onto the hard glass, he peeps a mouse-like grunt as he fights to not fall face-first into the table. His abdomen quivers as his core alights on fire—straining, tensed harder than the stone of a rock golem.
         Meanwhile, you’re sliding off his tail. It’s like a slick penny, you’ve lost your handhold and you cannot find another. You slip and slide on your belly, slipping past the band of his braies—medieval short-like underwear—and continue falling along the red brick path of his outer thigh. After a handful of heart-pounding moments where you slap your hands uselessly against his scales, your slide concludes with you tumbling into the cloth bed of the insides of his braies. In the dim light, you see his sweat-soaked scales trembling slightly as he struggles to hold his position over the table. The fiber of his braies are uncomfortably moist; dark splotches pocked across the surface show that parts most soaked in the kobold’s nervous sweat. It comes as a bit of a surprise: you conclude that the kobold is clearly warm-blooded. Body heat irradiates the cramped, musky chamber you’ve been dumped in. His unwashed scales vomit a smell that bestows upon you a mental image that’s so gods-damned clear, you’re sure it had to have been painted by an elf: his ass smelled like a rat’s—a rat’s ass that had been smothered in an ratfolk’s dirty underwear that was rescued from the garbage heap. Or perhaps the sewer. From what your nose has gathered, this blasted, scale-covered rat probably wasted his only two silver buying drinks—instead of proper toilet paper.
         “Hnngh… I got it!” the kobold squeaks. You hear the screech of the ale dragging across the countertop. You feel yourself moving—backwards. The kobold is reeling the ale towards the end of the table like the catch of the day. And given his butt’s moving downward, you have a feeling you’re going to be trapped between a rock and a hard place real soon....
1513.title: He rights himself! He’s reaching across the t...

choices: Climb the inside of the braies
Climb the scales
The kobold is adjusting himself!
15132.content:
You're thrown around the confines of the braies as your kobold captor struggles to remain balanced upon the spindle of the stool, constantly launched between the sweat covered scales and foul smelling underwear as the creature unknowingly holding you hostage rights himself. You eventually come to rest in a particularly moist area of the braies, the ungodly stench mixing with the smell of unwashed underwear provides no relief to your nostrils as the kobold finally starts to settle and sit back down on the chair.

No longer at risk of being thrown around, you waste no time in bringing some of the cloth of your robe to your face to give yourself some sort of reprieve from the hellscape you've found yourself. Able to take stock of your surroundings now, you noticed the scaled thighs to the left and right of you, which can only mean you're at the front of the underwear. Which means...

You look up and see a large slit perturbing the landscape of scales above you. The cloaca. While this would ordinarily mean the privates of the kobold would be just that, private, it was pretty clear that the kobold had become somewhat excited from his ordeal as a pink mound of slick flesh was beginning so snake its way out of the opening, a bead of precum leaking from its mouth before scattering over the penis like a giant raindrop.

The sweltering humidity of the environment draining your will to act you decide to...
15132.title: Underwear and Unlucky

choices: Misses you
Hits you, bringing you along for the ride
151323.content: Your sweaty prison starts to quake all around you as you have to grip onto the disgusting moist braies to not be thrown to the ground. The answer to the turbulence comes quickly, as the darkness of your musk filled chamber suddenly vanishes as light beams in from above, a massive draconic hand descending down like some sort of deity. As much as it pains you to compare a measly little kobold to a god, the once small creature has now very much turned the tables on you as the colossal hand quickly darts around the confines of your putrid cavern. Has he felt you? No, it’s more likely he’s just adjusting his nethers in an attempt to get comfortable. Unfortunately for you, there is little you can do as the hand…
151323.title: A shift here, a shaft there...

choices: Retracts from the nethers
Heads towards the privates
1513231.content: You can only watch as the colossal hand darts all over the confines of the pants, patting down and pulling areas of the strained fabric as it moves around, stalking you like some kind of predator. Luckily however, the hand never finds you and the kobold loses interest in adjusting himself, clearly more concerned with the affairs free from the musk laden pants of a small draconic creature. You watch as the hand...
1513231.title: Missed

choices: He gets more excited
He loses interest
A glob of pre falls from above
15132312.content: You watch as the hand rests itself upon the exposed privates of the kobold, the sound of nails against slick flesh in your ears as the hand gives the exposed flesh a few scratches and rubs. You can only look on in horror as you hope your captor wasn’t about to get too frisky, otherwise your prison would become a lot more hectic…
15132312.title: A private encounter

choices: Spoke too soon – you’re shrinking
All good, no adverse effects
151323123.content: You can only watch as the idle rubbing and circling continues above, mild purring and groaning coming from the kobold as he continues to relax; you just thank the creature that he’s keeping tame for the time being at least. In your gratefulness however, you fail to notice a bead of clear fluid starting to gather at the tip of the cock, slowly growing in size until the tip is unable to hold it any more. You are unprepared then, when the sky is blotted out once again as a bead of precum the size of your body hits you square in the chest. The process is humiliating and leaves you a little winded as you attempt to recover and wipe yourself down, but you don’t seem to suffer any other ill effects.
151323123.title: A flood of kobold

choices: Oni
Firbolg
Continue looking around
155.content:
The bustling inn contains many other patrons, too.

Sitting at one table you see a red, hulking figure of an oni, downing another mug of mead ungraciously as it spills onto his half-covered chest and gut. You can see the demon wear a tattered kimono, a loincloth held up by a thick rope belt, and wooden sandals that seem as tall as a castle wall to you. He does seem pretty intimidating and rough-natured...

There is also a large firbolg, the nature giant chatting with acquaintances, adorned in light traveler’s clothes and boots. You can tell by the small details at your stature’s perspective how much the big blue lug has spent outdoors. Despite his burly and towering form, perhaps his affinity with nature might help in detecting you for help...?
155.title: Something else...

choices: The Iron Giant knock-off it is!
Or perhaps a Godzilla type is more your speed?
There's still a few patrons you haven't checked out yet. Keep looking around.
1553.content:
You continue your search for suitable assistance, straining your eyes as you look towards the back of the tavern. A rather curious pair of travelers sits at a table, sharing a round of drinks between them.

On the left is a colossus whose body seems to be made of wood and metal. A warforged, if you recall correctly. Living constructs that were made to fight in a war or some such. This one is particularly bulky, standing head and shoulders over his companion despite being seated. Not wearing much in the way of clothing either; the bare minimum of threadbare pants around his waist. Come to think of it, can Warforged even get drunk? He doesn't seem to be bothered much, laughing boisterously and knocking back mug after mug of ale. His massive wooden feet, each sporting three metal "toes," are planted firmly on the ground and look like they'd be suitable for climbing.

To his right is a humanoid dragon, covered in emerald scales and quite beefy in his own right. Though he may prove more of a challenge as he sits slumped over the table, grasping his mug and muttering something to his companion. A hefty tome sits at his side, a tempting option that may prove key in curing your current affliction should the monstrous drunk sober up anytime soon. His clawed feet, in stark contrast to the warforged, are constantly moving, toes flexing and curling as if they had minds of their own.

Well, what'll it be?
1553.title: Shades of Pacific Rim, whatever that is.

info.brief_description: Can you surive being shrunk around unusual creatures?
info.description:
UPDATE: Just wanted to clarify I'm okay with races or monsters that aren't D&D related; so long as they're monstery/weird enough (run this by me if you're not sure). I'm also alright with custom races, but please ask me before adding them if that's okay :).

You hail from a realm where creatures of vastly different origins have learned to be peaceful and coexist with one another, being able to work together and live together in relative harmony. As a wizard residing in one of the major cities of this realm, you are an arcane reseacher; studying spells and their peculiar effects. That is, until one day when you were investigating what you thought to be a relatively benign transmutation spell when it backfired on you. When you recovered, you discovered you were in some place alien yet familar, one of the many taverns in town, except, something was different. You were much, much smaller than its patrons.

Small and unnoticed by the many inhabitants of the bar, your only option is to find some way back to your arcane lab and reverse the effects of the spell. Will you be able to find your way back to your lab? Will you be able to get the attention of one of the patrons? Will you survive being SHRUNK AT THE LITTLE DAGGER INN?

Rules:
I'm not going to be too strict with the rules here other than the obvious (no excessive gore, no underage characters, no one line chapters, kinks are fine so long as they don't break the above) however I will give some advice:
- Try to avoid having the main character noticed straight away, you can have them be noticed after a few chapters if you want
- While I prefer male characters, I'm not going to stop people from adding female characters
- If you're adding a new race to the tavern try and be creative with it. I made this story to give some love to some of the races I never see in these kinds of stories.
- None of the races here are evil by nature, they have strengths and weaknesses just like anybody else

Other than that, enjoy your stay at the inn :)
